intro: Seriphidium subchrysolepis, commonly known as the goldenleaf tansy, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Mediterranean and parts of southern Europe. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, silvery-gray foliage that reflects sunlight, aiding in water conservation. It produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the Asteraceae family. Seriphidium subchrysolepis is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures.
